Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the amount of money Puerto Rico received for hurricane relief by stating it received $91 billion, when in reality it received about $11.2 billion.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or sources to back up the statement that Puerto Rico received $91 billion for the hurricane.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the amount of money Puerto Rico received is the highest ever for a hurricane, which is not true as the federal government spent more on Hurricane Katrina aid.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Puerto Rico received $11.2 billion in disaster relief payments, not $91 billion.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim presents an alternative explanation by including future FEMA costs "over the life of the disaster" to reach the $91 billion figure, which is not an accurate representation of the actual funds received.
Understate: The claim understates the actual amount of money Puerto Rico received by stating it got $91 billion, when in reality it received $11.2 billion.
